summary.long: Revelation is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The revelation from Jesus Christ that God gave him to show his servants the things that must soon take place. Christ expressed this revelation by means of symbols sent through his angel to his servant John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John spoke as a witness to the word of God and to the testimony about Jesus Christ, that is, to everything he saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the one who reads the words of this prophecy and blessed are those who hear it and hold on to the things written in it, because the time is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
John,
To the seven churches in the province of Asia:
Grace to you and peace from him who is, who was, and who is coming, and from the seven spirits that are before his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth.
To him who loves us and has freed us from our sins by his own blood
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and made us a kingdom and priests to God his Father—to him be the glory and the power forever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, he is coming with clouds,
and every eye will see him,
including those who pierced him.
And all the nations of the earth will mourn because of him.
Yes. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” says the Lord God, the one who is, and who was, and who is coming, the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, John, your brother and companion in the suffering and kingship and patient endurance in Jesus, was on the island called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was in spirit on the Lord’s Day, and I heard a loud voice behind me, like a trumpet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Write what you see on a scroll and send it to the seven churches: to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I turned to see the voice that was speaking to me. When I turned, I saw seven gold lampstands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and among the lampstands was one like a son of man. He was clothed with a robe that reached to his feet, and around his chest he wore a gold sash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His head and his hair were white, like white wool or like snow. His eyes were like blazing flames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His feet were like polished bronze being refined in a furnace. His voice was like the roar of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He held seven stars in his right hand. A sharp two-edged sword was coming out of his mouth. His face was shining as the sun shines in all its brightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I saw him, I fell at his feet like a dead man. He placed his right hand on me and said, “Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Living One. I was dead and, see, I am alive forever and ever! I also hold the keys of death and hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So write what you have seen, both those things that are and those that will take place after this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The mystery of the seven stars, which you saw in my right hand, and the seven gold lampstands is this: The seven stars are the messengers of the seven churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven churches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Ephesus write:
The one who holds the seven stars in his right hand, who walks among the seven gold lampstands, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know your works, your labor, and your patient endurance, and that you are not able to tolerate evil people. You have tested those who say they are apostles, but are not, and have found them to be liars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, you do have patient endurance. You have endured hardships on account of my name and have not become weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have this against you: You have forsaken your first love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, therefore, the state from which you have fallen! Repent and do the works you did at first. Otherwise I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place, if you do not repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do have this: You hate the actions of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who is victorious I will give the privilege to eat from the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Smyrna write:
The First and the Last, who was dead and came to life again, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know your suffering and your poverty—but you are rich. And I know the blasphemy that comes from those who say they are Jews but are not; rather, they are a synagogue of Satan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not fear anything that you are about to suffer. Look, the Devil is about to throw some of you into prison so that you will be tested, and you will suffer for ten days. Be faithful until death, and I will give you the crown of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. He who is victorious will not be hurt at all by the second death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Pergamum write:
The one who has the sharp, two-edged sword says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know where you live—where the throne of Satan is. And I know that you hold fast to my name. You did not renounce your faith in me even in the days when Antipas, my faithful witness, was put to death near you, the place where Satan lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a few things against you: You have some people there who hold to the teaching of Balaam, who instructed Balak to put a stumbling block in front of the children of Israel so that they would eat things offered to idols and commit sexual immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, you also have some people who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, repent! If not, I will come to you soon, and I will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who is victorious I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give him a white stone with a new name written on it, which no one will know except the one who receives it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Thyatira write:
The Son of God, whose eyes are like fiery flames and whose feet are like polished bronze, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know your works and love and faith and service, as well as your patient endurance, and that you are doing more now than you did at first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have this against you: You allow that woman Jezebel, the one who calls herself a prophetess, to deceive my servants and to teach them to commit sexual immorality and eat things offered to idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave her time to repent, but she is not willing to repent of her sexual immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I am going to throw her onto a bed and throw those who commit adultery with her into great suffering, if they do not repent of her works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will put her children to death. And all the churches will know that I am the one who searches hearts and minds, and that I will give to each of you according to your works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the rest of you in Thyatira, who do not hold to this teaching, who do not know Satan’s “deep things,” as they call them, I say that I will not lay any other burden on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only hold fast to what you have until I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the one who is victorious and continues to do my works until the end, I will give him authority over the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will rule them with an iron staff and shatter them like clay pots,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as I myself have received authority from my Father. I will also give him the morning star.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Sardis write:
The one who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars says this:
I know your works. You have a reputation for being alive, but you are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wake up, and strengthen what is left, which is about to die, for I have found that your works are not complete in the sight of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore remember what you received and heard. Hold on to it and repent! If you do not wake up, I will come like a thief, and you will not know at what time I will come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have a few names in Sardis, people who have not defiled their clothes. They will walk with me in white clothing, for they are worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is victorious in this way will be clothed in white clothing. I certainly will not erase his name from the Book of Life, and I will acknowledge his name before my Father and his angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Philadelphia write:
The Holy One, the one who is true, the one who has the key of David, the one who opens and no one can shut, and who shuts and no one can open, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know your works. Look, I have set before you an open door, which no one can shut. I know that you have little strength, and yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I will make those who are from the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews and are not but are lying—look, I will make them come and bow down at your feet, and make them realize that I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have kept my word about patient endurance, I will also keep you from the hour of testing, which is about to come over the whole inhabited world, to test those who dwell on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am coming soon. Hold on to what you have so that no one takes your crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is victorious I will make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he will never leave it again. I will also write on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God—the new Jerusalem, which is coming down out of heaven from my God—and my new name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the messenger of the church in Laodicea write:
The Amen, the faithful and true witness, the ruler of God’s creation, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. If only you were cold or hot!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, because you are lukewarm and not hot or cold, I am about to spit you out of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say, “I am rich. I have become very wealthy and need nothing.” But you do not know that you are miserable, pitiful, poor, blind, and naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I advise you to buy from me gold refined by fire, so that you may be rich, and white garments, so that you may be clothed and the shame of your nakedness may not become public, and salve to anoint your eyes, so that you may see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rebuke and discipline those whom I love. So take this seriously and repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I stand at the door and I am knocking. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will go in with him and dine with him, and he with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the one who is victorious I will give the right to sit with me on my throne, just as I was victorious and sat down with my Father on his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things I looked, and there was a door opened in heaven! And the first voice that I had heard speaking to me like a trumpet said, “Come up here, and I will show you what must happen after these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately I was in spirit. And look! A throne was standing in heaven, and someone was sitting on the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who was sitting there looked like a jasper stone and a ruby. Around the throne there was a rainbow that looked like an emerald.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also around the throne were twenty-four thrones, and sitting on those thrones were twenty-four elders dressed in white garments, with gold crowns on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the throne came flashes of lightning, rumblings, and crashes of thunder. In front of the throne seven flaming lamps were burning, which are the seven spirits of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also in front of the throne was something resembling a glassy sea, which was like crystal.
In the middle, near the throne and around the throne, there were four living creatures, full of eyes in front and in back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first living creature was like a lion, the second living creature was like an ox, the third living creature had a face like a man, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each one of the four living creatures had six wings, and the wings were full of eyes all around and underneath. Day and night, without pause, they keep saying:
Holy, holy, holy,
Lord God Almighty,
who was and who is and who is coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the living creatures give glory, honor, and thanks to him who sits on the throne, the one who lives forever and ever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-four elders bow down before him who sits on the throne. They worship the one who lives forever and ever and lay down their crowns in front of his throne as they say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Worthy are you, our Lord and God,
to receive the glory and the honor and the power,
    for you have created all things,
    and because of your will they existed and were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw a scroll in the right hand of him who sat on the throne, with writing on the front and on the back, sealed with seven seals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll by breaking its seals?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one in heaven or on the earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll or to look into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I began to weep bitterly because no one was found who was worthy to open the scroll or to look into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the elders said to me, “Stop weeping. Look! The Lion from the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed and is able to open the scroll and its seven seals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw a Lamb standing in the center, near the throne, surrounded by the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders. The Lamb seemed to have been slain, and he had seven horns and seven eyes (these are the seven spirits of God that have been sent into all the world).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lamb came and took the scroll out of the right hand of him who sat on the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lamb took the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders bowed down before the Lamb. Each one had a harp and gold bowls full of incense (these are the prayers of the saints).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they sang a new song, saying:
You are worthy to take the scroll and to open its seals,
    because you were slain,
    and you bought us for God with your blood
        out of every tribe and language and people and nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made them to be a kingdom and priests for our God,
and they will reign on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and I heard the voice of many angels who were around the throne and around the living creatures and the elders. Their number was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands upon thousands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a loud voice they were saying:
Worthy is the Lamb who was slain to receive
power and riches and
wisdom and strength and
honor and glory and blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also heard every creature that is in heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and all that is in them, saying:
To him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb
be blessing and honor and glory and might forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The four living creatures said, “Amen,” and the elders bowed down and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I watched when the Lamb opened the first of the seven seals. And I heard one of the four living creatures say with a voice like thunder, “Come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and there was a white horse, and its rider held a bow. A crown was given to him, and he went out conquering and to conquer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lamb opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another horse, a fiery red one, went out. Its rider was given power to take peace away from the earth so that people would slaughter one another. And a great sword was given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lamb opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come.” And I looked, and there was a black horse. Its rider had a scale in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard something like a voice from among the four living creatures say, “A quart of wheat for a denarius, and three quarts of barley for a denarius. And do not dilute the oil and the wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and there was a pale green horse. And its rider was named Death, and the Grave followed closely behind him. They were given power over a quarter of the earth, to kill people with the sword, with famine, with death, and by the wild animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lamb opened the fifth seal, under the incense altar I saw the souls of those who had been slaughtered because of the word of God and because of the testimony they had maintained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called out with a loud voice, saying, “O Lord, holy and true, how long until you judge and exact justice for our blood from those who live on the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A white robe was given to each one of them. And they were told to rest a little longer until their number would be complete, when their fellow servants and their brothers would be put to death as they were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I watched when the Lamb opened the sixth seal. There was a great earthquake. The sun became as black as sackcloth made of hair. The entire moon became like blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stars of the sky fell to the earth as a fig tree drops its unripe figs when it is shaken by a strong wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sky was removed like a scroll being rolled up. Every mountain and island was moved from its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth, the nobles, the military leaders, the rich, the powerful, and everyone—slave or free—hid in caves and among the rocks of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept saying to the mountains and the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the great day of their wrath has come. Who is able to stand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this I saw four angels, who stood at the four corners of the earth. They were holding back the four winds of the earth so that the wind could not blow on the earth, the sea, or any tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw another angel coming up from the east, who had the seal of the living God. He called out with a loud voice to the four angels who were given power to harm the earth and the sea. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not harm the earth, the sea, or the trees until we have placed a seal on the foreheads of God’s servants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I heard the number of those sealed:
144,000 sealed from all the tribes of the people of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Judah, 12,000, who were sealed,from the tribe of Reuben, 12,000,from the tribe of Gad, 12,000,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Asher, 12,000,from the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000,from the tribe of Manasseh, 12,000,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Simeon, 12,000,from the tribe of Levi, 12,000,from the tribe of Issachar, 12,000,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000,from the tribe of Joseph, 12,000,from the tribe of Benjamin, 12,000, who were sealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things I looked, and there was a great multitude that no one could count, from every nation, tribe, people, and language, standing in front of the throne and of the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and with palm branches in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They called out with a loud voice and said:
Salvation comes from our God, who sits on the throne, and from
    the Lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the angels stood around the throne, the elders, and the four living creatures. They fell on their faces before the throne and worshipped God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying:
            Amen. Blessing and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and
    power and might belong to our God forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One of the elders spoke to me and said, “These people dressed in white robes, who are they and where did they come from?”
And I answered him, “Sir, you know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to me:
These are the ones who are coming out of the great tribulation.
They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of
    the Lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this they are in front of the throne of God,
    and they serve him day and night in his temple.
He who sits on the throne will spread his tent over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will never be hungry or thirsty ever again.
The sun will never beat upon them, nor will any scorching heat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd.
He will lead them to springs of living water.
And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lamb opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel, holding a gold censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given a large amount of incense to offer together with the prayers of all the saints on the gold altar that was in front of the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the smoke of the incense went up from the hand of the angel before God, together with the prayers of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it on the earth. Then there came crashes of thunder, rumblings, flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven angels, who had the seven trumpets, prepared to sound them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first sounded his trumpet, and hail and fire mixed with blood were thrown on the earth. A third of the earth was burned up, and a third of the trees were burned up, and all the green grass was burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a great mountain burning with fire was thrown into the sea. A third of the sea became blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a third of the creatures that live in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the third angel sounded his trumpet, and a huge star, blazing like a lamp, fell from the sky. It fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the star was Wormwood, and a third of the waters became wormwood. Many of the people died from these waters because they had been made bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the fourth angel sounded his trumpet, and a third of the sun was struck, as well as a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of them became dark. And there was no light for a third of the day and likewise for the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked and I heard a single eagle flying in the middle of the sky, saying with a loud voice, “Woe, woe, woe to those whose home is on the earth because of the remaining trumpet blasts of the three angels who are about to sound their trumpets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the fifth angel sounded his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen out of heaven to the earth, and the key to the pit of the abyss was given to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He opened the pit of the abyss, and smoke came up out of the pit like the smoke from a huge furnace. The sun and the air were darkened by the smoke from the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And out of the smoke came locusts on the earth, and they were given the kind of power that scorpions of the earth have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were told not to harm the earth’s grass, any green plant, or any tree, but only those people who do not have God’s seal on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, they were not given permission to kill these people but only to torture them for five months. And the pain they cause is like the pain caused by a scorpion when it stings a person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days people will seek death but will certainly not find it. They will long to die, but death will escape them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The locusts looked like horses ready for battle. On their heads were what appeared to be crowns that were like gold. Their faces looked like human faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had hair that looked like women’s hair, and their teeth were like lions’ teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had breastplates that appeared to be made of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of many chariots and horses charging into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had tails with stingers like those of scorpions, and in their tails they had power to hurt people for five months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have the angel of the abyss over them as their king. His name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek he has the name Apollyon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One woe is past. Look! After these things two more woes are coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sixth angel sounded his trumpet, and I heard a voice speak from the four horns of the gold incense altar that is before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It said to the sixth angel, the one with the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the four angels who had been prepared for this hour, day, month, and year were let loose so that they could kill a third of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of soldiers on horseback was two hundred million. I heard their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is what I saw in the vision of the horses and their riders: They had breastplates that were fiery red, hyacinth blue, and sulfur yellow. The heads of the horses were like the heads of lions, and out of their mouths came fire and smoke and sulfur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result of these three plagues, the fire and the smoke and the sulfur that came out of their mouths, a third of mankind was killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails, for their tails are like snakes that have heads, which they use to cause injuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the people, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands by giving up their worship of demons and idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone, or wood, which cannot see, hear, or walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did not repent of their murders, their sorceries, their sexual immoralities, or their thefts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another powerful angel coming down out of heaven. He was clothed with a cloud, a rainbow was over his head, his face was like the sun, his feet were like pillars of fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he had in his hand a little scroll, which had been opened. He put his right foot on the sea and his left on the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he cried out with a loud voice, just as a lion roars. And when he cried out, the seven thunders spoke using their own voices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seven thunders had spoken, I was about to write. But I heard a voice from heaven, saying, “Seal up the things that the seven thunders said, and do not write them down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he swore by the one who lives forever and ever, who created the sky and the things in it, the earth and the things in it, and the sea and the things in it. He said, “There will be no more delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, in the days of the sound made by the seventh angel, that is, when he is about to sound his trumpet, the mystery of God will also be completed, exactly as he made this good news known to his servants the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The voice that I heard from heaven also spoke to me again, saying, “Go, take the scroll that has been opened in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I went to the angel and said to him, “Give me the little scroll.”
He said to me, “Take it and eat it. It will make your stomach bitter, but in your mouth it will be as sweet as honey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took the little scroll out of the angel’s hand and ate it. It was as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I had eaten it, my stomach was made bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to me, “It is necessary that you prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a measuring rod like a staff was given to me. He said, “Stand up and measure the incense altar and the temple of God and those who worship in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exclude the outer court of the temple and do not measure it, because it has been given to the heathen. They will trample the holy city for forty-two months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will commission my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, clothed in sackcloth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the two olive trees and the two lampstands that are standing before the Lord of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to harm them, fire is going to come out of their mouths and consume their enemies. If anyone should want to harm them, it is necessary that he be killed in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two have the authority to shut the sky so that no rain falls during the days when they are prophesying. They also have authority over the waters, to turn them into blood, and the authority to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they finish their testimony, the beast that comes up from the abyss will fight against them, conquer them, and kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their dead bodies will lie on the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some from the peoples, tribes, languages, and nations will look at their dead bodies for three and a half days and will not permit them to be placed in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who dwell on the earth will also rejoice over them and celebrate by sending gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented those who dwell on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three and a half days the breath of life from God came into them. They stood on their feet, and a great fear fell on those who saw them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, “Come up here.” They went up into heaven in a cloud, as their enemies watched them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment there was also a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city collapsed. Seven thousand people were killed by the earthquake, and the survivors were terrified and gave praise to the God of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second woe is past. See, the third woe is coming soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the seventh angel sounded his trumpet, and there were loud voices in heaven, saying:
The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and
    of his Christ,
and he will reign forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-four elders, who were sitting on their thrones before God, also fell on their faces and worshipped God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying:
We thank you, Lord God Almighty, who is, and who was,
    because you have taken your great power and reigned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations were angry, and your anger has come.
And the time has come
    when the dead are to be judged, and
    when you will give the reward to your servants the prophets
            and to your saints,
            namely, to those who fear your name, the small
                and the great, and
    when you will destroy those who destroy the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God’s temple in heaven was opened and the Ark of his Covenant was seen in his temple. And there were flashes of lightning, rumblings, crashes of thunder, an earthquake, and a great hailstorm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great sign appeared in the sky: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet and a crown of twelve stars on her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She was pregnant, and she cried out in pain and agony as she gave birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another sign also appeared in the sky: There was a huge red dragon that had seven heads and ten horns and seven crowns on his heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His tail swept away a third of the stars in the sky and threw them to the earth. The dragon stood before the woman, who was about to give birth, so that he could devour the child as soon as it was born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who will shepherd all the nations with an iron rod. Her child was snatched up to God and to his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God in order that she might be fed there for 1,260 days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a war in heaven. Michael and his angels fought with the dragon. The dragon fought back along with his angels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he was not strong enough. There was no longer a place for them in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The great dragon was thrown down—the ancient serpent, the one called the Devil and Satan, the one who leads the whole inhabited earth astray—he was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying:
Now have come the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God
    and the authority of his Christ,
because the accuser of our brothers has been thrown down,
    the one who accuses them before our God day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They conquered him
    because of the blood of the Lamb and
    because of the word of their testimony.
They did not love their lives in the face of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason, rejoice, you heavens and those who dwell in them.
Woe to the earth and the sea,
    for the Devil has gone down to you.
    He is full of rage, because he knows that his time is short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dragon saw that he was thrown down to the earth, he pursued the woman, who had given birth to the male child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman so that she might fly to her place in the wilderness, where she is to be fed for a time, and times, and half a time, away from the presence of the serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the serpent spewed water out of his mouth, like a river, after the woman, in order to carry her away in the flowing water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the earth helped the woman. The earth opened its mouth and swallowed the river, which the dragon had spewed out of its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dragon was angry about what had happened to the woman, and he went away to make war against the rest of her children—those who keep the commandments of God and who hold on to the testimony about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood on the shore of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw a beast rising out of the sea. He had ten horns with ten crowns on his horns, and seven heads with blasphemous names on his heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast that I saw was like a leopard, and his feet were like those of a bear, and his mouth was like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave the beast his power, his throne, and great authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One of his heads seemed to have been fatally wounded, but his fatal wound was healed.
And the whole world that followed the beast was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They worshipped the dragon because he gave authority to the beast. They worshipped the beast, saying, “Who is like the beast, and who can go to war against him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast was also given a mouth that spoke arrogant and blasphemous things. He was given authority to do these things for forty-two months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast opened his mouth to speak blasphemies against God: to blaspheme his name, his dwelling, and those who dwell in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was also given permission to wage war against the saints and to overcome them, as well as authority over every tribe and people and language and nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who make their home on the earth will worship the beast—those whose names have not been written from the beginning of the world in the Book of Life, which belongs to the Lamb that was slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has an ear, let him hear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If anyone is to be imprisoned, he is going to be imprisoned.
If anyone is to be killed with a sword, he is going to be killed with a sword.
Here patient endurance and confidence are needed by the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another beast coming up out of the earth. He had two horns like the Lamb, and he spoke like the dragon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He exercises all the authority of the first beast on his behalf. He causes the earth and those who make their home on it to worship the first beast, whose mortal wound was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He performs great miracles, even making fire come down from heaven to earth in the sight of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also deceives those who make their home on the earth because of the miracles that he was permitted to perform on behalf of the beast, telling those who make their home on the earth to make an image for the beast who had been wounded by the sword but lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This beast was also given the ability to give breath to the image of the beast, so that the image of the beast spoke and caused whoever did not worship the image of the beast to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also makes all people, small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, receive a mark on their right hands or on their foreheads,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that no one may buy or sell unless he has the mark—the name of the beast or the number of his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is wisdom: Let the one who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, because it is the number of a man. His number is 666.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and there was the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him 144,000 who had his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard a sound from heaven like the roar of many waters and like the sound of a loud thunderclap. The sound that I heard was also like the sound of harpists playing their harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were singing a new song in front of the throne and the four living creatures and the elders. No one was able to learn that song except the 144,000, who had been purchased from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who were not defiled with women, because they are virgins. They continually follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among mankind as firstfruits for God and the Lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no lie was found in their mouths. They are blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another angel flying in the middle of the sky. He had the everlasting gospel to proclaim to those who live on the earth, to every nation, tribe, language, and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said with a loud voice:
Fear God and give him glory,
    because the hour of his judgment has come.
Worship him who made the sky, the earth, the sea, and the springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel, a second, followed. He said, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon the Great, who made every nation drink from the wine of her adulterous desire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel, a third one, followed them. He said with a loud voice, “If anyone worships the beast and his image and receives a mark on his forehead or on his hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will also drink from the wine of God’s wrath, which has been poured undiluted into the cup of his anger, and he will be tormented with burning sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and the Lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the smoke of their torment is going to rise forever and ever. Those who worship the beast and his image, and anyone who receives the mark of his name, are going to have no rest day and night.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here patient endurance is needed by the saints, who hold on to the commands of God and their faith in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I heard a voice from heaven say, “Write: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.”
“Yes,” says the Spirit, “because they will rest from their labors, for their works follow them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and there was a white cloud, and seated on the cloud was one like a son of man. He had a gold crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel came out of the temple and cried with a loud voice to the one sitting on the cloud, “Swing your sickle and begin reaping, for the time to reap has come, because the harvest of the earth is very ripe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one sitting on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the earth was harvested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel, who also had a sharp sickle, came out of the temple, which is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And another angel, who was in charge of the fire, came from the altar and cried with a loud voice to the one who had the sharp sickle, “Swing your sharp sickle and harvest the grape clusters from the earth’s vine, because its grapes are ripe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel swung his sickle over the earth, and he harvested the earth’s vine and threw it into the great winepress of God’s wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The winepress was trampled outside the city, and blood flowed from the winepress, as high as the horses’ bridles for a distance of 1,600 stadia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another great and remarkable sign in heaven: seven angels with seven plagues—the last plagues, because in them God’s wrath is completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw what looked like a sea of glass mixed with fire. I also saw those who had won the victory over the beast and his image and over the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass. They held the harps of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they were singing the song of Moses, God’s servant, and the song of the Lamb. They said:
Great and marvelous are your works, Lord God Almighty.
Just and true are your ways, King of the Nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will not fear you, Lord,
    and who will not praise your name?
You alone are holy!
All the nations will come and will bow down before you,
    because your righteous verdicts have been revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things I looked, and the sanctuary of the Tent of the Testimony was opened in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven angels who hold the seven plagues came out of the sanctuary. They were clothed with clean bright linen, and they wore gold sashes around their chests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the four living creatures gave the seven angels the seven gold bowls full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sanctuary was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from his power. No one was able to enter the sanctuary until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard a loud voice from the temple say to the seven angels, “Go and pour out the seven bowls of God’s wrath on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first angel went and poured out his bowl on the earth, and horrible and painful sores came on the people who had the mark of the beast and who worshipped his image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea, and it became blood like that of a dead man, and every living creature in the sea died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and the springs of water, and they turned into blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I heard the angel of the waters say:
You are righteous, the one who is and who was, the Holy One,
    because you have made these judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they poured out the blood of saints and prophets,
you have given them blood to drink.
They deserve it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard the incense altar, saying, “Yes, Lord God Almighty, true and just are your judgments.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and it was allowed to burn people with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were scorched by the fierce heat. Then they blasphemed the name of God, who had authority over these plagues, but they did not repent and give him praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast. The beast’s kingdom was darkened. People gnawed their tongues in their torment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They blasphemed the God of heaven because of their torments and their sores. But they did not repent of their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river, the Euphrates. Its water was dried up to prepare the way for the kings coming from the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw three unclean spirits, like frogs, which came out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are, in fact, miracle-working, demonic spirits, which go out to the kings of the whole earth to bring them together for the battle on the great day of the Almighty God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look: I am coming like a thief. Blessed is the one who stays awake and keeps his clothes on, so that he does not walk around naked and his shame is not seen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought them together to the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh angel poured out his bowl on the air. And a loud voice came out of the temple from the throne, saying, “It is done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were flashes of lightning, rumblings, and crashes of thunder. There was also a great earthquake of a kind that has not occurred since mankind has been on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the great city split into three parts, and the cities of the nations collapsed. Babylon the Great was remembered by God, and he gave her the wine cup filled with his fierce wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every island vanished, and the mountains could no longer be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Massive hailstones, about one hundred pounds each, fell on people from the sky. And the people blasphemed God because of the plague of hail, because the plague was so severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and spoke to me. He said, “Come, I will show you the judgment on the great prostitute who is sitting on many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth have committed sexual immorality with her, and those who make their home on the earth have become drunk on the wine of her immorality.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel carried me in spirit into a wilderness. And I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was covered with blasphemous names and had seven heads and ten horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was clothed with purple and scarlet and was adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls. In her hand was a gold cup full of abominations and the filth of her sexual immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And on her forehead this name was written:
Mystery
Babylon the Great,
the mother of the prostitutes
and of the abominations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I saw that this woman was drunk from the blood of the saints and the blood of Jesus’ martyrs.
When I saw her, I was greatly amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to me, “Why are you amazed? I will tell you the mystery of the woman and of the beast that carries her, the one that has seven heads and ten horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast that you saw: He existed, is no more, and he is about to come out of the abyss and go to destruction. Those who make their home on the earth, whose names have not been written in the Book of Life from the creation of the world, will be amazed when they see the beast, because he existed, is no more, and will exist again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A mind that has wisdom is needed here: The seven heads are seven hills on which the woman is sitting. They are also seven kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come, but when he comes, he must remain for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The beast that existed and is no more is the eighth king (who is one of the seven) and is going to go to destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ten horns that you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but along with the beast they will receive authority like kings for one hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They share one purpose and they will give their power and authority to the beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will wage war against the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them, because he is Lord of Lords and King of Kings. Those who are with him are the called, the elect, and the believing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel also said to me, “The waters that you saw, where the prostitute is sitting, are peoples, multitudes, nations, and languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ten horns and the beast that you saw will hate the prostitute and will cause her to be abandoned and naked. They will also eat her flesh and burn her with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has put it into their hearts to carry out his purpose, namely, to agree to give their royal authority to the beast until the words of God are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman whom you saw is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things I saw another angel coming down out of heaven. He had great authority, and the earth was given light by his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He called out with a loud voice, saying:
Fallen, fallen, is Babylon the Great.
She has become a dwelling place for demons,
    and a prison for every unclean spirit,
    and a prison for every unclean bird,
    and a prison for every unclean and hated beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the nations have drunk from the wine of her adulterous desire,
    and the kings of the earth committed adultery with her,
    and the merchants of the earth became rich from the abundance of her luxury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I heard another voice from heaven say:
Come out of her, my people,
    so that you will not share in her sins,
    and so that you will not receive any of her plagues,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because her sins have reached heaven
    and God has remembered her crimes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay her back even as she has paid.
Pay her back double for what she has done.
In the cup that she mixed, mix her a double portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As much glory and luxury as she gave herself,
give that much torture and grief to her,
    because in her heart she says:
            I sit as a queen,
            I am not a widow, and
            I will never mourn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason her plagues will come on a single day:
death, mourning, and famine,
and she will be burned in fire,
    because the Lord God, who judges her, is powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The kings of the earth who committed adultery and lived in luxury with her will weep and mourn for her when they see the smoke from her burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will stand far away because of terror at her torment and say:
Woe, woe, the great city,
Babylon, the strong city!
    For your judgment came in a single hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The merchants of the earth also weep and mourn over her, because no one buys their cargo anymore,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a cargo of gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, fine linen, purple cloth, silk, scarlet fabric, every kind of aromatic wood and ivory article, and every article made of precious wood, brass, iron, and marble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also cinnamon, spice, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, olive oil, high quality flour, grain, cattle, sheep, horses, and carriages, as well as bodies and souls of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The fruit your soul desired has left you. All your costly and splendid things have passed away from you. No one will ever find them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The merchants who sold those things and were made rich by Babylon will stand far away out of terror at her torment. They are going to weep and mourn,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying:
Woe, woe to the great city that was clothed in fine linen
and purple and scarlet,
adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because such great wealth was made a wasteland in a single hour.
“Every ship captain and all the ocean travelers and the sailors and those who make their living on the sea stood far away
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cried out when they saw the smoke rise from her burning. They said, ‘Who is like the great city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They threw dust on their heads and cried out as they wept and mourned, saying:
Woe, woe to the great city
by whom all who have ships on the sea were made rich from her treasures,
    because she was made a wasteland in a single hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice over her, heaven,
also you saints, apostles, and prophets,
    because God has judged her for the judgment you received from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A mighty angel picked up a stone like a large millstone and, as he threw it into the sea, he said:
This is the way Babylon, the great city,
    will be overthrown with violence and
    will never again be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of harpists and musicians, flutists and trumpeters,
    will never be heard in you again.
No craftsman of any trade
    will ever be found in you again.
The sound of a millstone
    will never be heard in you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of a lamp
    will never shine in you again.
The voice of bridegroom and bride
    will never be heard in you again,
because your merchants were the great ones of the earth,
because your witchcraft led all the nations astray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the blood of prophets and saints was found in this city,
along with the blood of all those who were slain on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After these things I heard what seemed to be the loud sound of an immense crowd in heaven, saying:
Alleluia!
Salvation and glory and power belong to our God,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: A second time they said, “Alleluia! Her smoke goes up forever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures bowed down and worshipped God, who sits on the throne, saying, “Amen! Alleluia!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the throne came a voice that said, “Praise our God, all you his servants and you who fear him, small and great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I heard what seemed to be the roar of a large crowd or the roar of many waters or the sound of loud rumblings of thunder, saying:
Alleluia!
For the Lord our God, the Almighty, reigns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us rejoice and be glad and give him glory,
        because the wedding of the Lamb has come.
His bride has made herself ready,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and she was given bright, clean, fine linen to wear.
(In fact, the fine linen is the “not guilty” verdicts pronounced on the saints.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to me, “Write: Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding supper of the Lamb.” He also said to me, “These are the true words of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I bowed down at his feet to worship him. But he said to me, “Do not do it! I am a fellow servant with you and your brothers, who have the testimony about Jesus. Worship God. For the testimony about Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw heaven standing open, and there was a white horse! Its rider is called Faithful and True, and he judges and makes war in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His eyes are like blazing flames, and on his head are many crowns. He has a name written on him, which no one knows except he himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is also clothed in a garment that had been dipped in blood, and his name is the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armies in heaven, which were clothed with white, clean, fine linen, were following him on white horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of his mouth comes a sharp sword with which to strike down the nations. He will shepherd them with an iron staff. He himself is going to trample the winepress of the fierce anger of the Almighty God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On his garment and on his thigh this name is written: King of Kings and Lord of Lords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw an angel standing in the sun, and he called out with a loud voice to all the birds that were flying in the middle of the sky. He said:
Come, gather together for God’s great supper,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that you can eat the flesh of kings,
    and the flesh of military leaders,
    and the flesh of mighty men,
    and the flesh of horses and of their riders,
    and the flesh of all people, both free and slave, and small and great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies gathered together to make war against the rider on the horse and his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast was captured along with the false prophet who performed miracles on his behalf, with which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and had worshipped its image. These two were thrown alive into the Lake of Fire, which burns with sulfur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest were killed with the sword that comes out of the mouth of the rider on the horse. And all the birds gorged themselves on their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven. He had the key to the abyss and a great chain in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He seized the dragon, the ancient serpent, who is the Devil and Satan, bound him for a thousand years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: threw him into the abyss, locked it, and set a seal on it, so that he could no longer deceive the nations until the thousand years come to an end. After this he must be released for a short time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw thrones, and those who were sitting on them were given the authority to judge. And I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded because of their testimony about Jesus and because of the word of God. They had not worshipped the beast and his image, and they did not receive his mark on their forehead and on their hand. They lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The rest of the dead did not live until the thousand years came to an end.) This is the first resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed and holy is the one who has a share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them. Instead they will be priests of God and of Christ. And they will reign with him for a thousand years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the thousand years come to an end, Satan will be released from his prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go out to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth—Gog and Magog—to gather them for battle. They are as numerous as the sand of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came up over the broad expanse of the earth, and they surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. And fire came down from God out of heaven and devoured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Devil, who deceived them, was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet are. There they will be tormented day and night, forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw a great white throne and the one who sat on it. The earth and the sky fled from his presence, and no place was found for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also saw the dead, great and small, standing in front of the throne, and books were opened. Another book was also opened, which is the Book of Life. The dead were judged by the things written in the books, according to what they had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sea gave up the dead that were in it, and Death and the Grave gave up the dead that were in them, and they were judged, each one according to what he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death and the Grave were thrown into the Lake of Fire. The Lake of Fire is the second death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone’s name was not found written in the Book of Life, he was thrown into the Lake of Fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, because the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. And the sea no longer existed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw the Holy City, the New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the throne I heard a loud voice that said, “Look! God’s dwelling is with people. He will dwell with them, and they will be his people. God himself will be with them, and he will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will wipe away every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or sorrow or crying or pain, because the former things have passed away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who was seated on the throne said to me, “Look, I am making everything new!” He also said, “Write, for these words are trustworthy and true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said to me:
It is done.
I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End.
To anyone who is thirsty,
    I will give freely from the spring of the water of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who overcomes
    will inherit these things.
I will be his God,
    and he will be my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who are cowardly, unbelieving, detestable,
    murderers, adulterers, sorcerers, idolaters, and all the liars
    will have their share in the lake burning with fire and sulfur,
    which is the second death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls that were filled with the seven last plagues came and spoke with me. He said, “Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He carried me away in spirit to a great and high mountain, and he showed me the Holy City, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It has the glory of God. Its radiance is similar to a very precious stone, like crystal-clear jasper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It has a large, high wall. It has twelve gates. Twelve angels are at the gates, and twelve names are engraved on the gates, the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three gates are on the east, three on the north, three on the south, and three on the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city’s wall also has twelve foundations, and on them are the twelve names of the Lamb’s twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who spoke with me had a gold measuring rod so that he could measure the city, its gates, and its wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city is laid out as a square. Its length and width are equal. He measured the city with the measuring rod: 12,000 stadia. Its length, width, and height are equal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also measured its wall by human measurement, which was what the angel used: 144 cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wall is made of jasper, and the city is pure gold, like pure glass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foundations of the city’s wall had been adorned with every kind of precious stone.
The first foundation is jasper,
the second sapphire,
the third agate,
the fourth emerald,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth onyx,
the sixth ruby,
the seventh diamond,
the eighth beryl,
the ninth topaz,
the tenth turquoise,
the eleventh jacinth,
the twelfth amethyst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelve gates are twelve pearls. Each of the gates is made out of one pearl. And the street of the city is pure gold, like transparent glass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not see a temple in the city, because the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city does not need the sun or the moon to shine on it, because the glory of God has given it light, and the Lamb is its lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will walk by its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their glory into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no day when its gates will be shut, for there will be no night in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing that is unclean and no one who does what is detestable or who tells lies will ever enter it, but only those who are written in the Lamb’s Book of Life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel showed me the river of the water of life, which was as clear as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and the Lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the middle of the city’s street and on each side of the river was a tree of life that yielded twelve kinds of fruit. The tree yields its fruit every month, and its leaves are for the healing of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will no longer be any curse. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be in the city. His servants will worship him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will see his face. His name will be on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will no longer be any night or any need for lamplight or sunlight, because the Lord God will shine on them. And they will reign forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to me, “These words are faithful and true. The Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, sent his angel to show his servants what must soon take place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And look: I am coming soon! Blessed is the one who holds on to the words of the prophecy of this book.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. When I heard and saw them, I bowed down to worship at the feet of the angel who showed me these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to me, “Do not do it! I am a fellow servant with you and your brothers the prophets, and also with those who hold on to the words of this book. Worship God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel also said to me:
Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this book, because the time is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the one who is unjust continue to be unjust.
Let the one who is filthy continue to be filthy.
Let the one who is just continue to do what is just.
Let the one who is holy continue to be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I am coming soon and my reward is with me, to repay each one according to what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those who wash their robes, so that they may have the right to the Tree of Life and so that they may enter through the gates into the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside are the dogs, that is, the sorcerers, the adulterers, the murderers, the idolaters, and everyone who loves and practices falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Jesus, have sent my angel to give you this testimony for the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, the bright Morning Star.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit and the bride say, “Come.” And let the one who hears this say, “Come.” And let the one who is thirsty come. Let the one who wants the water of life take it as a gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give this warning to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If anyone adds to them, God will add to him the plagues that are written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his share in the Tree of Life and in the Holy City, which are written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who testifies about these things says, “Yes, I am coming soon.”
Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with all the saints. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
